ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: This class provides a very helpful overview of local land use law with ample opportunity to explore personal subject matter interests. Marjorie is a dedicated and passionate instructor, always happy to field questions or accommodate students' personal interests. Marjorie's passion for the subject matter and real-life anecdotes from her ample experience created a fun and learning-conducive environment. Nice to get a practitioner's perspective!

Marjorie did an excellent job of satisfying all different interests and levels of knowledge throughout the course. Even though the class was small it was comprised of different disciplinary backgrounds that could have made it difficult to teach the course, but Marjorie made sure that no one was left behind.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The pacing of the class is a little tricky because it includes law and non-law students who need different amounts of background material. The course might function a little more smoothly if oriented toward one group or the other, but regardless accomplishes it's purpose to cover an area of law often overlooked in law school. Sometimes class could go off on a tangent, which could be fun or a little frustrating depending on your interest in the tangent.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
Why did you take this course?
Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes - Marjorie does a great job of incorporating real-life scenarios into the case law, which exceeded my expectations because we gained an understanding of how the law works in practice.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This course is very helpful to legal and non-legal students alike; even if land conservation is not your field. It is very important to understand local governance in dealing with environmental problems, and Marjorie does an excellent job of explaining this system. It is very helpful regardless of whether you desire a career in land use.

Marjorie is passionate about land use law and committed to students understanding the material. It was a great introduction to case law for me. I have a much stronger grasp on legal vocabulary and process and feel better equipped to participate in land use law-related conversations now. Due to our small class size, we were able to frame the course material around students' specific interests.
